title: U.S. Aims to Peel Back Shell Companies by Requiring New Ownership Rules
sub_head: Rules proposed by the Treasury Department require more information on owners and agents who register companies
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”The Treasury Department proposed new corporate-reporting rules meant to help unmask criminals, terrorists and others who use opaque ownership structures to hide money laundering and other illicit activities.
Under the proposed rules, announced Tuesday, companies will be required to provide personal identification information on the primary owners and the people who register the companies, Treasury officials said.
